channel.title: comprehension on Memo Tut
channel.description: Recent content in comprehension on Memo Tut

item.title: Nested comprehensions in Python
item.description: Conclusion: If you forget which one of the nested comprehensions is the inner, remember it is the same as when you wrote it down in the for loop. I forgot how many times I forgot so I took a note Single comprehension First a basic example. >>> [x * 2 for x in [1,2,3,4,5]] [2, 4, 6, 8, 10] You can create a list by applying an expression to each element of the list by doing “[Expression using variable for variable in list]`.
